title: Duncan Bell (rugby union)
text:
Duncan Stuart Crampton Bell (born 1 October 1974 in King's Lynn, Norfolk) is an English <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player currently playing for <a href="Lydney%20Rugby%20Football%20Club">Lydney Rugby Football Club</a> in the <a href="National%20League%202%20South">National League 2 South</a>. Educated at <a href="Colston%27s%20Collegiate%20School">Colston's Collegiate School</a>, Bristol, he is an <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> international with five <a href="cap%20%28sport%29">caps</a>.
Born in <a href="Norfolk">Norfolk</a>, Bell was raised in the <a href="South%20Gloucestershire">South Gloucestershire</a> village of <a href="Hawkesbury%20Upton">Hawkesbury Upton</a>. He attended <a href="Colston%27s%20Collegiate%20School">Colston's Collegiate School</a> with <a href="Chris%20Taylor%20%28cricketer%2C%20born%201976%29">Chris Taylor</a> the <a href="Gloucestershire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Gloucestershire</a> cricketer with whom he shares a great friendship. Bell first played rugby for Bath Minis and later for Bristol U17's and colts whilst attending Colston's Collegiate school.
Club career.
Bell had joined <a href="Harlequin%20F.C.">NEC Harlequins</a>, but was unable to win a professional contract. Bell then spent a season with <a href="Ebbw%20Vale%20RFC">Ebbw Vale</a>, prior to a four-year spell with <a href="Sale%20Sharks">Sale</a>.
He made the move to <a href="Pontypridd%20RFC">Pontypridd</a> in 2001. During his time at the club, Bell won the 2002 <a href="WRU%20Challenge%20Cup">Principality Cup</a> and was a finalist in the <a href="2001%E2%80%9302%20European%20Challenge%20Cup">2002 Parker Pen Shield</a>.
In 2003, Bell moved to <a href="Bath%20Rugby">Bath</a>. Bell played in the final of the <a href="2007%E2%80%9308%20European%20Challenge%20Cup">2007–08 European Challenge Cup</a>, as Bath defeated the <a href="Worcester%20Warriors">Worcester Warriors</a>.
In 2012, Bell announced his retirement from rugby at the end of the 2011/2012 season, and announced he was battling depression throughout his career.
In February 2014 Bell came out of retirement to represent Newport Gwent Dragons. making nine appearances that season. For the 2014/2015 season he is playing for Lydney.
International career.
Bell was first called up to the England squad in 1998 on the so-called <a href="1998%20England%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20Australasia%20and%20South%20Africa">"Tour of Hell"</a>. Bell was named on the bench to face <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia</a>, but did not take the field.
Bell was selected for <a href="England%20Saxons">England A</a> in a fixture against <a href="France%20A%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">France A</a> in 2004, which he snubbed in favour of representing Wales in the future. Due to regulations, Bell was not allowed to join the Welsh summer tour of Argentina, later that year the <a href="International%20Rugby%20Board">IRB</a> confirmed he could not represent Wales.
In 2005, Bell played for <a href="England%20Saxons">England A</a> against <a href="France%20A%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">France A</a>. He was subsequently called up for the senior squad to compete in the <a href="2005%20Six%20Nations%20Championship">2005 Six Nations</a>, making his <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> debut against <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Italy</a>. Bell played in the following fixture against <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a>. Bell was also a member of the <a href="2006%20England%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20Australia">2006 summer tour of Australia</a>.
Due to injuries, Bell was selected for the <a href="2009%20end%20of%20year%20rugby%20tests">2009 Autumn Internationals</a>. Bell featured in all three games, against <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Australia</a>, <a href="Argentina%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Argentina</a> and <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand</a>.
